reviews.content: This hospital's ER is amazing and everyone that I dealt with was wonderful, pleasant and calming. Only bad part, I told them I was having an asthma attack and I had to sit in the waiting area until my name was called trying to suck in air. Once I got to the back though, they were efficient and had me in and out of there in no time. There was no ridiculous wait in between seeing nurses, the doctor, the respiratory specialist, and the x ray guy. Everything went smoothly and they made sure I had every and all prescriptions I needed. I give them 2 thumbs up! Especially being some one new who just relocated here. It really made a great impression on me.

I'm a "frequent flyer" here with severe chronic pulmonary problems. Each time I stay it's never perfect (what is?!) but this last time the hospitalist was a bully, dismissive and complete liar. Now thanks to him my permanent record has serious falsities which will directly impact any future care I would receive if I return here. Very disappointing as this is the only hospital my pulmonologist goes to and I feel like I can never go again. Not only did he lie on my records but he left important negligence out (10 days with no BM, I had to dig it out myself! Or how I fell because the chair tipped, that I had a catheter full of bloody urine that my friends alerted them to etc.) . So while there's some great staff here, the abuse and neglect I received as well as future judgement which will impede care in a critical situation is why I gave 1 star.

Nurses in the endoscopy center were top notch and extremely kind.  I was just a visitor but was still treated well and their volunteer staff was jist so friendly.  If you have to have a medical procedure here, I would  highly reccomend.

My five star rating is for the swift service in the ER. Anytime I have had to bring someone here the waiting room is never over crowded, it is extremely clean, the staff don't treat you like you're interrupting their day, and they get you back as quickly as possible so they can get you treated. No one likes hospital visits but they make the process a tad less stressful.

Great Hospital great care have visited many friends here fortunately never been the patient but always had a great experience here last night the nurse Amanda took care of one of my best friends and was truly a caring great nurse if you ever feeling sick under the weather or need surgery I would recommend going to this hospital and getting yourself taken care of

I got very sick 3 days ago spiked a high  temp. I could not shake it. I finally went to Centre Care for treatment. I paid the 60 dollar co pay. The doctor recommended the emergency room. When I got to Fl Hospital Altamonte they admitted me and did the usual.  I had to pay an additional 250 deductible and the discharge person was rude . I was shivering and pain in my scrotum(UTI). Headache and Nausea. They gave me antibiotics and something for the nausea. They released and I went home. I woke up at 3 am in severe pain. I waited till morning and called the hospital. I spoke to one of the charge nurses. She told me the nurses have nothing to do with the money and transferred me to financial services. I spoke to Rita told me to come in if I was sick. My goal was to have the night doctor admit me. . She told me that florida Hospital was a faith based organization. And that they would help.. I did not want to incur all the expense for tests they did last night.  So I drug myself to the hospital. I met with Rita in financial services. She now tells me that there was nothing she could do, and that she was calling the charge nurse. She told me to sit and a waited. I'm so sick. But it doesn't seem like they care. Don't know what's gonna happen I've been waiting 30 minutes.. There is no happy ending. I was admitted to the hospital after a 2 hour wait. Bottom line they still charged me for a second visit. I don't think anything was done about them making me wait. My recommendation is never get a bladder infection. Lok

Probably the slowest hospital in central FL . Flu season or not . I was in a bed for hours without medicine or tests being taken. I felt  like i was a burden to these tired nurses . Staff was yawning constantly I think I'm having an allergic reaction to my medicine I'm given after being admitted . No one believes me that my insides are on fire . I didn't come in this way. I'm really scared and might leave this hospital. My nurse Trenda was very kind and understanding. She could only do so much for me and I appreciate it

These people are a great example of kindness and service. I arrived at the hospital with an extreme emergency that required surgery. The team of nurses, doctors and staff were exceptional.  I am deeply grateful for all of their kindness warmth and caring.

Saturday afternoon about 4PM March 31st, 2018 a trip to the ER. Smooth arrival by Joshua. Taken back quickly to Examination. The whole Staff did a great job. The Nurse Practitioner Jeff Scott showed concern and handled the matter very well as did the Nurse. . If I had to be away from my preferred local Hospital, St. Mark's in LaGrange, Texas Florida Hospital Altamonte  was the place to be.  . Thanks for the fine job!!!!!!!!
Quickest admission ever for the emergency room. Still takes forever for all The process is EKGs CAT scans vitals and blood pressure blah blah blah... had to get a few stitches.
The MRI technicians here are some of the most incompetent, awful people you're liable to meet. Unless you enjoy being treated like crap by imbeciles, stay away.

Great praises to the doctors and staff in the ambulatory surgery center.  You took wonderful care of my mother.  You care and it really shows.  You're very well organized and provide top patient service.

If you are a women stay away! My daughter went to this hospital and was denied a female doctor for her pelvic exam. So they sent her home with Pepto! A week later we find out she had two Tumors in her uterus. A few months later she became pregnant thank the lord. She called me from the hospital that she had pain. Again she requested a female for the pelvic exam and was refused. So this time I went and found a female pa and she could not understand why was she not asked to do the exam since she was available. So we confronted the doctor and he  became aggravated and just walked away. Isn't It a women's right to ask for a genial to the test? If one is available why not!  I don't understand.

If I am literally dying and every other hospital has been closed down, then by all means take me here.  Otherwise, I forbid it!  . The first time I was taken to the ER here, I had an OK experience.  I was taken in by ambulance, so I was seen immediately.  The doctor and nurses were nice.  The tech who did my CT was nice.  . That first experience left me to believe this was an Ok hospital to come to. WRONG.. My second trip was also by ambulance.  It was pouring rain, it was February, and it was cold.  I was in an excruciating amount of pain.  When I got to the ER, they didn't take me in through the ambulance entrance, no no, they wheeled me in right through the main lobby where everyone was staring.  The a/c of the hospital hit my wet, already cold body and sent me shivering immediately.  Someone came out with paperwork asking me questions in front of everyone.  The pain was horrible and I was begging for towels and blankets.  They weren't too concerned with that... they just wanted me to answer personal questions out loud in front of the entire waiting room.  NO!  I refused, they took me back.  I lay there for a good 20 minutes in agony before a nurse finally came with towels to dry me off and blankets to help warm me.  She was also rude and nasty.. Onto the doctor.  He was worse than the nurse.  He was one of those doctors with the god-complex.  He was nothing but curt and condescending.  After running tests, he decided I needed to be admitted.  Ummm....  no thanks!  I won't go into details with the condition I had going on, but suffice to say the pain meds they eventually gave me kicked in, so I signed one of those papers saying I was leaving against medical advice.  My husband promptly put me in the car and drove me up to Jacksonville to my usual hospital where I could be admitted.  Yes, I had to go through the whole ER thing again, but it was a much more pleasant experience. . A month or so later when I was all well and feeling better, I had my husband take me back to this hospital so I could complain to an administrator in person.  When I got there, they sent me first to the records department so they could print out my records.  They said I would need them to talk with the administrator about everything that occurred during that horrible visit. . They printed my records for me and said I wouldn't be charged since I was having them printed for the administrator.  A few weeks later, I got a bill in the mail for $40 something dollars for that printed paperwork.  WTF?!?!  . I did speak with the administrator about my grievances and she was perfectly nice and listened to every word I said.  She promised the issues would be addressed.  Then I get the darn bill in the mail for that printed paperwork.  it took me months to finally get them to take that off my account.  In the meantime, they even turned me over to collections for it.  It was quite the headache!. So, again, unless I'm dying and there are absolutely no other hospitals, DO NOT TAKE ME HERE!!  Instead, head down to the hospital in Celebration:

I came with a migraine and left feeling worst. The PA and RN were amazing though. It was my care plan that lacked. The staff is phenomenal. I guess it's just regulations that won't allow them to give certain medications.
Your hospital is terrible. Many bad memories of this place. High incidence of contracting infection after surgery. Tells me cleanliness is not up to standards.

Went to visit a friend and it was my first time here, I was blown away by the cleanliness of the hospital and the the staff. Hospital is not a great place to be however the customer service was incredible!
Went for my lab work.  I got there at 6 AM, wife and both had blood drawn and out bu 6:10 AM.

I spent a few days at this location this fall visiting/assisting my grandfather.  I found the staff to be outstanding and it was a lovely surprise that my grandfather actually had the same nurses for much of his stay.  It certainly made it easier on me in explaining his issues/needs.  I also grabbed lunch here one day and found the offerings to be fresh and appetizing.  I went with one of the entrees of the day - fried rice and an egg roll.  The food was very good!

Wonderful service! They got me in really fast. I joked with the nurses, they were very descriptive and helped me understand what was going on. They really take the time to make you feel at home. The only downside is the wifi doesn't work well, however they do have a tv in the room that you can control from your bed. They were also quick to get me meds to help me feel more comfortable. Thanks FH!
